ratings.comment: I absolutely loved Robin for micro 304! You can tell that she really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. I cannot speak highly enough of Robin and I would recommend her to any students enrolling in 304.

Robin really helped me like micro!! Took 101 and 102 at the same time and the material overlapped so it was pretty easy. One homework assignment and a quiz every week for this class. The class was hybrid and we went into lab 5x this semester, every other week. Definitely recommend going to office hours because she is super helpful if you just ask!

Robin is very helpful and makes the class simple. Readings are complementary, and are typically not on the exam. The quizzes associated with them are somewhat hard but they are open notes online. Exams make up the majority of the grade, but tophat and other minor extra credit is offered. Final is noncumulative too.

Professor Kurtz is amazing. She makes everything very clear for what you will need to know for the exam. Exams are straight forward, not difficult if you look over the study guides she provides. The weekly readings and quizzes are a little difficult but not bad. Tophat used for attendance. Gives extra credit towards the end for a little boost.
Robin is awesome! Loved having her for lab. It's clear she knows her stuff, and is very straightforward and helpful. Microbio 304 is a heavy hitting class, but she makes it fun and very doable!

Robin is so awesome. The lectures are very clear & theyre all recorded so if you miss 1 or 10 its very easy to be caught up. Beware there is required top hat. Robin gives you study guides for all the units, and thats all you really need to study. Lots of extra credit in the end, so if you just study the minimum an A should be no problem.

You can tell Robin really wants all of her students to succeed and is willing to help in order to get you to where you want to be. Provides opportunities for extra credit which boosts your grade a lot considering the class is mostly made of exam points. Exams are literally the study guide and she's very straightforwards with what you need to know.

Robin was awesome. She presents the material in a very clear way that makes it easy to understand. Her study guides reflect the test extremely well. She really wants the best for all her students. If you have to take Micro 101, I would highly recommend taking her.

Although, I should have got an A but this was my first class after a year and half of graduating. I needed this class for a pre-requisite for PA school. Overall, great professor! She really cares. It is content that you really have to know and it is a lot of material but she makes it easy to understand. Her study guides reflect her exam really well

I loved this class! Professor Kurtz was very knowledgable and presented interesting information but was very clear about what we needed to study and what was just interesting or helpful information. She gives study guides which are amazing for exams and quizzes are online open book. Definitely would take a class by her again!
Best Bio professor so far. Hands down.
Awesome professor. Sweet and really cares about her micro students. Fantastic and knowledgeable .

Robin is one of my favorite professors I've had throughout college. She was so very helpful and easy to approach, unlike many professors. She gives you clear and constructive feedback, and genuinely cares about your success and growth in the microbio lab.
Best Professor I have had
She's one of my favorite professor's I've had. Robin is whip smart but also cares about learning useful knowledge. Highly recommend.

This is a lab class, so participation matters. Easy lab that I have taken at Madison. Robin and the TA who teaches the class are super helpful and easy to reach. Lab is fun, grade is mostly based off of stuff done in lab. There were two papers if you could call them that, about 1 page each. Two exams. Pay attention and participate and you do fine.

I took this class over the summer and Robin was truly amazing. She made the content come to life and kept my attention for the full length of the course.  Amazing professor. Best part? They put the readings online. No textbook!
She's honestly the greatest thing that happened to the microbiology department. She's great, explains extremely well, and is always willing to help. Take her if you can, and you won't regret it.
She gives out study guides before exams, study that info and you'll do fine. There is no required textbook, so you need to go to lecture and take good notes
Great professor, super clear and approachable.

Rushes through lecture and doesn't go that in depth.  Exams were nit picky.  There is no required textbook, so I studied my notes really well and felt prepared going in.  But I never received good grades :(

Super approachable, caring and nice. She gives out review sheets for exams and you'll only need to know about the materials on the review sheets. I go to her for questions a  lot and shes always really patient to answer all the questions. Definitely take her if you need microbio.
Really interesting professor. Cares about her students and very approachable.

Wonderful professor who is very approachable, is eager to help, great lecturer and kept class fun and engaging. It's been a couple of years since I've been out of school and this was my first class to go back to school; the experience was great and I am going to miss both her and the class.

Highly recommended elective for microbio majors, sheds a lot of light to the subject of microbiology. Dr Kurtz is very knowledgeable and makes her lectures interesting with small additions such as stories and historical facts. This class covers a lot of ground and a lot of effort is still required to do well. Highly recommended!

Very meaningful class, that gives you very good insight to the subject of microbiology. The class is well-designed and covers a lot of ground, hence a lot of effort needs to be put in to do well. Dr Kurtz is very knowledgeable and you can learn a lot from her lectures.

Host and microbe interaction, 3 exams, co-taught with robin. Well, to be honest, with such a high review from commentors below, I had a very high expectation. However, I would say she's ok, not phenomenal. I actually preferred Michelle over Robin. But, she's still great and awesome! Take this class!

Robin is the best professor I've ever had. I had her for 527 and 304. If you have any interest in Microbiology and you are debating between her and another professor or this course and another take hers. You will not regret it.
Makes class interesting with fun side stories, exam material is exactly what is on the lecture slides, always available to answer questions.  Awesome professor!
Extremely helpful and understanding!

Robin did a great job in the micro 330: host/symbiosis course. Well spoken, attentive, informative, receptive, makes herself available for questions/comments, offers advice, knowledgeable, and respectful. One of my top 3 professors of my college career from any discipline.

Robin is an excellent professor and incredibly helpful! She is very understanding if you are sick and can't make it to class or have med/grad school interviews and must miss. I'd highly recommend Robin although her class is tough!

Robin is a nice person, but a very strict grader-it is very frustrating.  Her policy is that if you meet all the requirements for assigments/papers and it's quality work, you'll get a B.  Only if it's especially extrodinary will you every get the full points (don't waste time trying).  Exams are very picky as well.  That said, I got an A.

Robin was a great lab instructor. She was extremely helpful when you asked her questions, and often gave good hints during class on what material would be on the exam. Make sure to read the directions carefully while taking exams, though, sometimes multiple choice isn't just one answer.

Robin is AWESOME! Extremely helpful. Don't hesitate to ask her for clarification on what you're doing. Lab report requirements can be somewhat vague--ask her to clarify, she'll help! Study lab manual for exams, know what you're actually doing. Great prof! Not an easy A class, but definitely one of my favorites!

Her exams are difficult if you aren't consciously aware of why you're doing what you're doing in lab. She's very helpful and wants everyone to succeed. By far one of the best professors I've had here.

Hard tests, but she is incredibly helpful.  One of the best labs I've ever taken.  Very knowledgeable, and she's really fun.  Know the formulas for the tests, verify you are calculating things correctly and practice.  Study her lab manual well.
Robin is awesome!  The chili pepper's no joke; gear up for fun!!!

Very Enjoyable.  Half of each exam/quiz are take-home and the other half of the quizzes are actually pretty easy if you put some time into studying.  Lab reports are easy as long as you dont forget anything, and the 2 essays aren't too bad.  Grades are curved at end of semester also.
Very helpful and reasonable; not a pushover class despite take-home exams.
